revised_title: Synthesis of Formaldehyde from Carbon Dioxide and Water by Inorganic Colloids Acting as Transformers of Light Energy
tldr: The authors investigate the synthesis of formaldehyde from carbon dioxide and water using inorganic colloids as catalysts for sunlight energy transformation. They demonstrate that these colloids can convert light energy into chemical energy, synthesizing organic compounds from inorganic matter, potentially playing a role in the origin of life.
